p.span: Before Care will run 7am-8am for a $100 monthly fee. Your child must be registered in advance. If you chose not to register, we ask that you arrive no earlier than 8am for drop off.

Information regarding the C.A.R.E. Program may be accessed via the Parent Tab on the District website. Announcements, contact information and registration documents will be maintained on an ongoing basis. Check this location for news & updates.

a.title: Go to comments for C.A.R.E. Program

span.span: All class parents & chaperones need to be fingerprinted and complete a background check. Instructions for this process may be found under the "Parents" tab.

$(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

span.p: I hope all of you had a restful spring break and are doing well during this health crisis. Many of you are probably aware Governor Murphy announced that schools will remain closed until at least May 15th. Accordingly, the administration and staff will assess and refine our Distance Learning Plan to continue to provide online learning, and meet the challenges that we may face ahead.

While we remain hopeful that we may be able to return to school, we are planning on how we may proceed with the end of year activities. Administrators and senior staff advisors will be researching various options for our students to be recognized, and to celebrate their achievements. We are currently working on having Kindergarten registration to be done on line; a separate message will be sent to inform our families when the link will be available. We are also focusing on the fate of summer school programs, both academic and extra curricular activities, and our Extended School Year for our students with special needs.

The unknown is a stressful time for all of us. I am confident we will meet the challenges ahead and will be reunited as a stronger community.
Stay well, be safe, and adhere to all mandated health issued guidelines.

**ALL Wood-Ridge and Moonachie HS students can pick up grab and go multiple day lunch meals on Mondays and Thursdays ONLY at the Wood-Ridge Intermediate School (151 1st St.) parking lot from 11am - 1pm.

span.strong: TO BE RESCHEDULED AT A LATER DATE

div.style: font-family: Arial, Tahoma, sans-serif; font-size: 13px; background-color: #ffffff;

div.span: The Wood-Ridge Public School District is committed to providing an excellent academic education that is rich in social and cultural programs. In collaboration with the faculty, support staff, administration and community, a learning environment is created which enables students to achieve their personal goals and develop into responsible and productive citizens.

span.div:
ADMINISTRATION: Provides highly effective leadership with support for students, faculty, and curriculum.
FACULTY: Quality teachers who are highly qualified, enthusiastic, caring, and compassionate. The faculty has high expectations for its students while recognizing and supporting their diversity.
STUDENTS: Educationally motivated, active participants with a sense of self-esteem and pride in their school, their personal achievements, and self-growth.
CURRICULUM: Challenging, innovative, and continuously responsive to the needs of students, both academic and extra curricula, while aligned with the New Jersey Core Curriculum Content Standards.
TECHNOLOGY: Enhances teaching and learning opportunities through integration in the curricula.
COMMUNITY: Incorporates the facilities and services of the community in order to enrich varied learning experiences.
CULTURE: Instills a sense of respect for school culture, community, and tradition, in preparation for their place in a global society.
FACILITIES: Maintains a safe and secure environment that is conducive to learning and teaching.

strong.a: Preparedness Plan Personnel Responsibilities updated March 19 2020

div.strong: We have partnered with the 15 school districts that comprise the South Bergen Jointure Commission. The Mutual Emergency Response Plan document outlines the SBJC and its member districts plans for dealing with Covid-19. Please click here for additional information:

a.href: /cms/lib/NJ01001835/Centricity/Domain/4/NJ DOH COVID-19 K-12 Guidance_ March 4th Update.pdf
